poem:
**A Pinch of Salt**

Graham weighed the world in grams and grains,  
cautioned against salty rains—  
the ghostly crystals on our plates,  
a ticking clock he equates   
to hearts and veins. His voice,  
a compass pointing to health's choice;  
a whisper through aisle and larder,  
urging us all to live longer,  
to live a little smarter.
